column4: updating to 8.10: now a popup asks wether i want to override changes to /etc/pam.d/common* i have no clue what this is... anybody?
if you have no clue, then just accept the maintainer's version
there's some bug on bugs.ubuntu.com about it that I found eralier.  Let me know if you can't find it
hm found several bugs reporting that issue, but just old ones
there was an open one from intrepid or hardy iirc
sry cant find it. if you have it at hand it would be great
the link to the bug report i mean
install cmake using synaptic, then read the documentation for your software
if you don't need it system wide, put it in your ~.  If you need it system-wide, I'd use /opt if it lacks a "unixy" structure and /usr/local/ otherwise
Dulak what is /usr/local/ actually supposed to be used for?
software you install without using the package manager
